decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - 1/ The conversion of the single-family property to six units is considered to be a cramped overdevelopment of the site which has resulted in inadequate room sizes and substandard living accommodation, detrimental to the residential amenity of the occupiers, out of keeping with the density and character of the St Stephen's Conservation Area, and detrimental to the residential amenities of the area, contrary to Adopted UDP policies ENV.1.1, H.1.2, ENV1.2 and H.1.5, and Revised Deposit Version (January 2001) UDP policies ENV-B.1.1, H 4.1, ENV B 2.2 and H.3.4.

Condition : 2 - 2/ The proposed parking arrangements, would fail to provide the council's parking standards, and would result in the loss of the front garden. The proposals would therefore result in conditions prejudicial to the free flow and safe movement of motorists and pedestrians in the area, and would detract from the character and appearance of the St Stephen's Conservation Area, contrary to Adopted UDP policies ENV1.2 and T.2.5, and Revised Deposit Version (January 2001) UDP policies ENV B 2.2 and T.1.4.
description: RETENTION OF CONVERSION OF EXISTING SINGLE-FAMILY DWELLINGHOUSE INTO 4 X ONE-BEDROOM FLATS AND 2 X STUDIO FLATS
